article_title: 100+ Women Who Care Choose New Non-Profit
article_text:
Sioux Falls, SD

A group of Sioux Falls women helped out an area non-profit Sunday.

100+ Women Who Care Sioux Falls met in the downtown Holiday Inn Sunday afternoon. The group meets twice a year, where they decide which non-profit gets the money raised by the 100 dollars each woman has to pay to be a member.

Previous Story: 100+ Women Who Care Expands

"When we gave NAMI $11,300, Phyllis, the Executive Director, she was ecstatic. She's like 'That money is going to last us for a couple of years,'" Ellen Hamilton, on the Board of Directors for 100+ Women Who Care Sioux Falls, said.

The lucky winner Sunday was KidStop, a local before and after school program aimed at enriching low-income and refugee children from kindergarten through 8th grade.

104 women attended Sunday's meeting. 53 of them were new members.
